description: An unassuming but capable muzzle brake, above average in terms of recoil reduction.  <muzzle_device_rating_556>  <muzzle_brake_descriptor>

variants.description: An unassuming but capable muzzle brake, this one is capable of reducing recoil by almost 60%.  <muzzle_device_rating_556>  <muzzle_brake_descriptor>  <variant_black>

notes: same outer diameter as A2 birdcage, which accepts NATO 22 mm rifle grenades

description: This modern-looking muzzle brake is one of the best on the market.  <muzzle_device_rating_556>  <muzzle_brake_descriptor>

variants.description: A highly-potent muzzle brake, capable of reducing recoil of a firearm up to 84%, enabled by its advanced geometry.  <muzzle_device_rating_556>  <muzzle_brake_descriptor>  <variant_black_matte>
A highly-potent muzzle brake, capable of reducing recoil of a firearm up to 84%, enabled by its advanced geometry.  <muzzle_device_rating_556>  <muzzle_brake_descriptor>  <variant_silver_matte>

description: A heavy-looking muzzle brake that extends mostly to the side.  This one is among the best on the market in terms of recoil reduction.  <muzzle_device_rating_556>  <muzzle_brake_descriptor>

variants.description: This flat, heavy-looking muzzle brake is among the best on the market, with recoil reduction of up to 78%.  Despite the name, it's not made of titanium.  <muzzle_device_rating_556>  <muzzle_brake_descriptor>  <variant_black_matte>

description: A shiny steel-gray muzzle brake with hollowed-out vents, capable of reducing recoil by more than 56%.  <muzzle_device_rating_556>  <muzzle_brake_descriptor>

variants.description: A hollowed-out muzzle brake capable of reducing recoil by more than 56%.  <muzzle_device_rating_556>  <muzzle_brake_descriptor>  <variant_black_glossy>
A hollowed-out muzzle brake capable of reducing recoil by more than 56%.  <muzzle_device_rating_556>  <muzzle_brake_descriptor>  <variant_steel>

notes: diameter assumed from V Seven FURION

description: This square, shiny dark-gray muzzle brake with large cavities is capable of reducing recoil by a large margin.  <muzzle_device_rating_556>  <muzzle_brake_descriptor>

variants.description: ESA, or Enhanced Stabilization Attachment, is a square muzzle brake with two-and-a-half large cavities.  It's capable of reducing recoil by up to 60%.  <muzzle_device_rating_556>  <muzzle_brake_descriptor>  <variant_black_glossy>

description: A muzzle brake of an unassuming design, performing about average.  Suppressors that require a KeyMo mount can be attached to it.  <muzzle_device_rating_556>  <muzzle_brake_descriptor>

variants.description: This unassuming muzzle brake is capable of reducing recoil by more than 56%.  It can also host a variety of suppressors that require a KeyMo mount.  <muzzle_device_rating_556>  <muzzle_brake_descriptor>  <variant_black_glossy>

//notes: this is currently using the 1/2-28× threading, which is for 5.56mm NATO or lower only
something like .308 would require a different thread
description: This unassuming but capable muzzle brake is capable of reducing recoil by a value well above average.  It can also be used to mount the heavy-duty suppressor.  <muzzle_device_rating_556>  <muzzle_brake_descriptor>

variants.description: An unassuming but highly-capable muzzle brake, the SR is capable of reducing recoil by more than 70%.  It can also serve as a mount for an equally-capable Dominus-SR suppressor, also from Thunder Beast.  <muzzle_device_rating_556>  <muzzle_brake_descriptor>  <variant_black_matte>

//weight: the PEW Science review states the weight of the 5.56mm NATO model to be 5.2 oz = 147.42 g

notes: diameter is assumed to be diameter of Dominus SR suppressor - 35%

//integral_longest_side: assumes mounting onto a standard length of thread for 1/2 in. × 28-threaded barrel (16 mm)
//handling_modifier: its 5.56mm cousin reduces recoil by 72.93%, so let's assume this one performs only slightly worse, at a completely-fictional 70.62%

//notes: SureFire SOCOM devices are not compatible with earlier SureFire Fast Attach devices
description: A muzzle brake that provides average improvement to the handling of the gun.  An accompanying sleek suppressor can be attached to the muzzle brake.  <muzzle_brake_descriptor>

variants.description: A fairly-standard muzzle brake, capable of reducing recoil by over 51%.  It can also serve as a mount for the SOCOM556-RC2 suppressor, also from SureFire.  <muzzle_brake_descriptor>  <variant_black>

notes: assumes that the dips and bumps even out
diameter is assumed based on similar muzzle brakes

//integral_longest_side: assumes mounting onto a standard length of thread for 1/2 in. × 28-threaded barrel (16 mm)
//handling_modifier: there's no accurate testing available for this brake, but it looks average enough, so we make up 51.62% recoil reduction
//price: presumed to be the price for the smaller caliber (.223 / 5.56mm)

description: A shot muzzle brake with a wheat-colored body, capable of reducing recoil by a significant amount.  With an Atlas thread adapter, you can mount a compact suppressor on top of it.  <muzzle_brake_descriptor>

variants.description: A short muzzle brake capable of reducing recoil by over 56%.  It can also serve as a mount for the Atlas thread adapter, which itself can be used to mount Atlas-thread suppressors, such as the Witt Machine Mod-1.  <muzzle_brake_descriptor>  <variant_fde_glossy>

notes: diameter is assumed based on similar muzzle brakes

//integral_longest_side: aligns with absorbing a standard length of thread for 1/2 in. × 28-threaded barrel (16 mm)
//handling_modifier: no data appears to be available on the performance of this muzzle brake, so we assume a random 56.22%
